definitions.example: multiple wipes of a computer's hard disk

definitions.definition: A soft piece of cloth or cloth-like material used for wiping.
A kind of film transition where one shot replaces another by travelling from one side of the frame to another or with a special shape.
A sarcastic remark; a reproof, a jibe.
To move an object over, maintaining contact, with the intention of removing some substance from the surface. (Compare rub.)
definitions.example: I wiped the sweat from my brow with the back of my hand.

definitions.definition: To remove by rubbing; to rub off; to obliterate; usually followed by away, off, or out.
To cheat; to defraud; to trick; usually followed by out.

definitions.example: I accidentally wiped my hard drive.

definitions.definition: To make (a joint, as between pieces of lead pipe), by surrounding the junction with a mass of solder, applied in a plastic condition by means of a rag with which the solder is shaped by rubbing.
To remove an expression from one's face.
definitions.example: You should wipe that smirk off your face before the boss comes in.

definitions.definition: A lapwing, especially a northern lapwing (Vanellus vanellus).
An instance of all members of a party dying in a single campaign, event, or battle; a wipeout.
To have all members of a party die in a single campaign, event, or battle; to be wiped out.
definitions.example: If you try to fight that boss underprepared, you're definitely gonna wipe.
